name: Candytuft
climate: Candytuft thrives in temperate climates, preferring mild temperatures.
This plant can tolerate some cooler temperatures but not extreme cold.
Candytuft can handle hot climates, but prefers moderate heat conditions.
Humidity is not crucial for candytuft, making it versatile across climates.
sunlight: Candytuft requires full sun exposure for optimal blooming and growth.
It can tolerate partial shade, but too much can limit flower production.
The plant benefits from at least six hours of sunlight per day for health.
In very hot regions, afternoon shade can help protect it from intense sun.
watering: Candytuft prefers well-drained soil and should not be overwatered.
Allow the soil to dry out between waterings to prevent root rot issues.
Watering should be consistent but not excessive, especially during blooming.
During dry seasons, increase watering slightly, but avoid waterlogging.
soil: Candytuft flourishes in sandy or rocky soils that ensure good drainage.
The soil should be slightly alkaline, enhancing nutrient uptake efficiency.
Avoid heavy clay soils as they retain too much moisture, harming roots.
Adding organic matter can improve soil texture and fertility for candytuft.
extra_care_tip: Prune candytuft after flowering to promote bushy growth and re-blooming.
Remove old flowers to prevent self-seeding, avoiding uncontrolled spreading.
